subject: AI & Agents
title: The Context Window: LLM Memory
description: A quick, practical guide to The Context Window: LLM Memory.

hook.text: Ask an LLM about something you said 50 messages ago. If it's outside the window, it's gone.

buildup.text: The context window is the maximum number of tokens an LLM can process at once.

discovery.text: GPT-4 Turbo handles 128,000 tokens. Claude handles 200,000. Earlier models had just 2,048.

twist.text: Bigger windows use more memory and compute. Cost scales quadratically with window size.

climax.text: New techniques like sliding windows and retrieval augmentation help work around limits.

punchline.text: LLMs don't remember. They just have a really long scratchpad.

quiz.question: What limits how much text an LLM can consider at once?
options: The context window size in tokens
The speed of the internet connection
